name: Gaige House, A Four Sisters Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Gaige House for 3 nights after seeing the rave reviews on trip advisor. It was a fine place to stay, we've seen better & we've seen worse, but, bottom line, it was not nice enough for a repeat visit:
reviews.title: neutral experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: most luxurious B&B breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast!
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: delightful kitchen staff
reviews.title: ok gaige

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Linens
reviews.title: Compared to Other $600 Rooms...

likes.disliked: — Charging for in-room coffee, sodas, no in room paper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were on a whirlwind tour driving from LA up the PCH to Sonoma and Napa. We stayed one night in off-the-beaten path Glen Ellen and loved our stay! We were upgraded to a suite (complimentary), and stayed in Woodside, which had a nice Zen-like modern bed and breakfast elegance. The suite had an idyllic bamboo leaf-filled private backyard with 2 chaise lounges overlooking a creek. The bed was comfortable, dimmable lighting throughout, roaring gas fireplace warmed up a chilly night, the provided CDs set a nice lounge mood. There was a fridge with bar sink and requisite wine opener. The Japanese bathroom featured a freestanding stainless soaking tub for 2 w/ bamboo tub filler, stainless freestanding washstand, and bamboo towel rack. Room had complimentary wireless internet and a lounge area.
reviews.title: Asian-influenced secluded getaway-Great Breakfast!

likes.liked: — Tranquil setting so close to all the vineyards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The morning breakfast for $15/pp was excellent. Fruit salad on a maize pastry, freshly baked scones, poached egg in hollandaise sauce and prosciutto with a nice side salad and fresh squeezed OJ. Cookies, coffee, tea left in the lounge for a midnight snack.
reviews.title: Great Quite hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: We also booked massages for the 2 of us. Reasonably priced at $120/pp for an hour. I didn't like the reflexology-it was just a glorified foot massage, but my GF enjoyed the deep tissue massage.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location minutes away from the vineyards, but in a quiet section of the valley.
reviews.title: Bit of a let down, really

likes.liked: — The wine and cheese hour was quite nice and cookies were fresh and delicious
likes.disliked: — Road noise; lack of privacy; poor value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk was friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations of vineyards.
reviews.title: Gaige - Major Disappointment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a driving vacation early in September, from Tacoma to San Luis Obisbo and back to San Francisco, along the coast and wanted to stay in the Napa/Sonoma area. We picked up on the Gaige House after staying at as very nice B&B in Mendocino. Although a little on the pricey side, we got a discount when we called for reservations and it turned out to be fabulous. The food was first rate, the grounds and the pool were beautiful and the service in general was terrific.
reviews.title: Great & very peaceful spot in Sonoma Valley

likes.disliked: — nasty speed bumps in the parking lot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was walking distance from several other very nice restaurants and it was peaceful and quiet. In room Hispeed was very fast and I don't recall paying extra for it either. The next day we visited several nearby wineries and explored a narrow winding road (Trinity Rd, off Hwt 12 a few miles north) that took us over the hills separating the Sonoma Valley from the Napa Valley. This is a place we will definitely go back to the next time we want to spend time in this part of California. By the way, they are now part of a small boutique
reviews.title: Off the beaten path...

likes.disliked: — Road noise and relative price to value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel chain, Thompson Hotels with properties in New York and Hollywoood.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Gaige House during a weekend trip to Napa/Sonoma for crush. Given the time of season we paid $400 plus tax per night for a standard room. We stayed in the main house, which was adequantely furnished - nothing special other than an interesting piece of art over the bed. The bed was very comfortable and linens were in good condition. The bathroom was a little dated, but the toilet and shower head had been updated to be more modern. My only compliant about the room was that it was in the front of the house so we heard a lot of road noise since the house sits on Arnold Drive. I'm sure rooms in the rest of the house or out back don't have this problem. Given the price, this left a bad taste in my mouth, but this was the cheapest room available at the property even several months in advance.
reviews.title: Loved our Creekside room.

likes.disliked: — Staff wasn't overly friendly, old television set located too far from bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very attentive without being overbearing. There is a nightly wine service in the main house and cookies, sodas and coffee available 24 hours a day. We didn't get the chance to experience breakfast, but we heard rave reviews from others.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth!

likes.disliked: — If I had to find something..maybe in the future they will offer a light lunch or dinner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best small hotel we've ever stayed in. Our "zen suite" was spacious and luxurious with fireplace, garden deck, wonderful bathroom. The staff attends to every need and is very knowledgeable about the area. Breakfast is amazing, and the wine/food hour is not to be missed.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful stay. The gardens are beautiful. We have a great room with a nice deck in the front. The bed was very comfty and the bathroom was great. The only reason I did not them a five was because we had to unplug the refrigerator at night because it was noisy. The breakfast was the best we have had at any B&B, we will definely be going back
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow what a place. I was worried i would not like it because it was so Zen in design but my travel agent friend said she had heard great things about it since it was taken over by the folks that own 60 Thompson in NY. We stayed in the Gaige Suite which is in the main house and has a huge private patio overlooking the pool. Wow, the bathroom, the sunken tub and huge shower...we felt like we were in luxury unexpected. Loved the breakfast and the chef really knows how to mix the foods. Favorite thing was the wine hour where we got to try a couple of wines from wineries we didnt get a chance to visit. Definately recommend you walk down to the Girl and the Fig restaurant for dinner. Staff is really attentive and super knowledgable about the area. It is so quiet at night you feel guilty talking on the patio but i guess that is part of the atmosphere. We will definately go back. Want to try out one of their spa zen suites next time, here they are something to see.
reviews.title: Initmate and sexy all in one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again the Gaige House provided excellent service and an outstanding experience! This inn provides a romantic getaway from SF in under two hours. Nestled in sleepy Glen Ellen minutes away from Matanzas winery and the Girl and the Fig, it is the ideal place to reconnect. Enjoy!!!
reviews.title: Wowed again!

likes.liked: — Great service and alot of privacy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, I found this property from comments here on Trip Advisor and want to thank whoever it was that mentioned it. This facility is impeccable. We mentioned that we were celebrating an anniversary in our reservation and they upgraded us to the Poolside Suite. This is a lovely Inn/B&B that is maintained in exceptional fashion. The staff was on top of every detail and very helpful regardless of the occassion. We had duo massages in their poolside area, it was a perfect way to end a stressful day of wine sampling :-)
reviews.title: Wow!

likes.liked: — staff and the service was first class at every level

aka: Gaige House, a Joie De Vivre Hotel Hotel
description: Tucked into the Sonoma Valley hamlet of Glen Ellen, the Gaige House feels like a secret hideaway. Of course, it’s not really a secret; the Gaige House is regularly recommended in Michelin and other guides, and has been listed repeatedly in Condé Nast Traveler’s Gold List of the top hotels in the world. Gaige House is part of the prestigious Four Sisters Inns collection and is an elegant blend of vintage and contemporary architecture. The inn features 23 thoughtfully appointed guestrooms with a modern, Asian flair. The verdant, secluded setting along Calabaza's Creek includes an outdoor swimming pool and hot tub, and is accented with delightful surprises in hidden spots: a hammock shaded with ancient oaks, a miniature pagoda in a rock garden, a gurgling fountain.After a day of visiting nearby wineries, boutiques and art galleries, return to the Gaige House to indulge in luxurious spa services provided either in-room, or outdoors in a peaceful and private cabana. All guests enjoy a complimentary, full breakfast every morning, and an afternoon wine and hors d’oeuvres reception.
